instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
threads.message: This board has no sound, bit it chimes. I understand that sound circuit is ok. Customer told me that there was something in audio jack and they removed it. As they touched sound jack could be this bad sound jack and I should replace it or there is something that I can measure before?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
threads.message: what does it think in sound preferences? headphone plugged in? digital out?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
threads.message:
I replaced headphone jack today.
Now no sound on speakers.
And only one channel works on headphones. Any idea what more to check? Still chimes when power.

Under os x, with headphones it let me control the sound, but only with speakers I cannot control volumen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
threads.message: Check if pin 1 and 2 of J6700 are shorted without a jack plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sound
threads.message: Yes, now one channel works. Thanks.
